LMS
  • app.models package
  • View page source

app.models package

Module contents

Learning Management System Models

This module contains all the database models for the LMS application, including User, Course, Lesson, Quiz, Assignment, and related models. Each model represents a database table and includes methods for data manipulation and serialization.

class app.models.UserRole(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for user roles in the system.

ADMIN = 'admin'
TEACHER = 'teacher'
STUDENT = 'student'
class app.models.User(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserMixin, Model

User model representing all system users.

id
username
email
password_hash
full_name
role
phone
age
created_at
updated_at
is_active
taught_courses
enrollments
quiz_attempts
assignment_submissions
achievements
set_password(password)[source]

Hash and set the users password.

check_password(password)[source]

Verify a password against the stored hash.

is_admin()[source]

Check if the user has admin privileges.

is_teacher()[source]

Check if the user is a teacher.

is_student()[source]

Check if the user is a student.

can_access_course(course)[source]

Check if user can access a specific course. Permission logic: - Admins: Can access all courses - Teachers: Can access courses they teach - Students: Can access courses theyre enrolled in (active or completed)

to_dict()[source]
__init__(**kwargs)

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instances class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

class app.models.Course(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Courses are created by teachers and can be enrolled in by students. Each course contains lessons, quizzes, assignments, and tracks student progress.

id
title
description
category
teacher_id
start_date
end_date
max_students
created_at
updated_at
is_published
lessons
enrollments
quizzes
assignments
certificates
get_enrollment_count()[source]

Get the number of currently enrolled students.

is_full()[source]

Check if course has reached maximum enrollment capacity.

class app.models.Enrollment(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Student enrollment in a course. Tracks a students participation in a course, including progress, completion status, and enrollment timeline.

id
student_id
course_id
enrolled_at
completed_at
status
progress_percentage
calculate_progress()[source]

Calculate overall course progress percentage. Progress is calculated based on: - Completed lessons - Passed quizzes (meeting passing score) - Submitted assignments

class app.models.Quiz(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Quizzes are assessments within a course that test student knowledge. Each quiz can have multiple questions and tracks student attempts and scores.

class app.models.Assignment(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Assignments are tasks given to students within a course. Each assignment can have a title, description, due date, and total points. Students can submit assignments, and teachers can grade them.

id
course_id
lesson_id
title
description
due_date
total_points
created_at
updated_at
submissions

class app.models.Achievement(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Achievements are rewards given to students for completing certain criteria in courses. Each achievement has a name, description, badge icon, points value, and criteria type.

class app.models.Certificate(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Certificates are issued to students upon successful completion of a course. Each certificate has a unique code, student ID, course ID, and issue date.

id
student_id
course_id
certificate_code
issued_at

class app.models.NotificationType(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for different types of notifications in the LMS.

MESSAGE = 'message'
ENROLLMENT = 'enrollment'
ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION = 'assignment_submission'
ASSIGNMENT_GRADED = 'assignment_graded'
QUIZ_SUBMISSION = 'quiz_submission'
QUIZ_GRADED = 'quiz_graded'
COURSE_COMPLETION = 'course_completion'
NEW_CONTENT = 'new_content'
CERTIFICATE_ISSUED = 'certificate_issued'
CERTIFICATE_REQUEST = 'certificate_request'
CERTIFICATE_APPROVED = 'certificate_approved'
CERTIFICATE_REJECTED = 'certificate_rejected'
USER_REGISTRATION = 'user_registration'
COURSE_PUBLISHED = 'course_published'
ACHIEVEMENT_EARNED = 'achievement_earned'
class app.models.NotificationPriority(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for notification priority levels.

LOW = 'low'
NORMAL = 'normal'
HIGH = 'high'
URGENT = 'urgent'

class app.models.CertificateRequest(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Certificate request model for students to request course completion certificates. Admins can review and approve or reject requests.

status
